Blog.post: Hooray! I made it through week one and am one day into week two. Things are going well, and I will continue to avoid the "restaurant" trap.

Since beginning on Thursday of Last week, I've only had one meal out. Technically it wasn't a meal, and it was at a concert, but I feel that it counts even more because of the low quality of food. So I had a pretzel and a large beer--my eating out for the week. At home I've been relatively good. Lots of salmon, some veggies, and a ton of fruit. I feel like I need this more defined, or I'll just eat a ton. But, the bet was to see if I could go a month with only eating out four times (which to some might seem like a lot of times to eat out, but in the Bay Area, most people eat out at least a couple times a week b/c there are so many great restaurants to try), and so I must remain faithful to those simplistic parameters. Work will be more challenging. Meetings tend to be catered, and the one meeting that always has these nice healthy sandwiches came packed with fried chicken on thursday (???not fair!). I didn't have another option for food, and I'm not sure if it counts as eating out, but I didn't pay for it, so I'm going to excuse it, since it's looked down upon to bring your lunch to these things. all right, that's it for now. WEEK 1: 16-Jul-2004, John Mayer Concert, Large Beer, Unsalted Pretzel. $11.50

So I decided to "officially" begin my first leg of this challenge--no eating out (well, once a week limit) for 30 days--on the 15th, rather than start on a random day. The beauty of this is that it's: a) payday, and b) easy to keep track of the 30 days. So today was my "last supper," and unfortunately I went big time with a disgustingly high fat lunch. "Ground Round" was the place...so not worth the price and dietary costs! Tomorrow I will do my first round of healthy shopping, keep track of the costs (It's got to beat $17 for a greasy lunch!), and see if I can do it. Good luck to me!

To not eat out for 30 days, and to lower the amount of processed foods in our diet. Will it work? Is it a worthy cause? Can I survive a month without fastfood in my life? Probably. Let's try! Moral support! Suggestions! Feedback! Oh my! help is greatly appreciated.

So I had a slip. I guess it was more about not missing a meal, then sticking with the program. I wasn't going to be able to eat for eight hours, and I was hungry. But, with Friday quickly approaching, I have not eaten out yet this week, and its' my last week of the challenge. Good for me!
